title: Oprah Winfrey chows down on 'gluten-free, egg-free, dairy-free' pancake for her challenge
text:
Oprah Winfrey settled down to a plate of pancakes for breakfast Saturday.

But since she is on the 12th day of her 30-day challenge requiring one 'plant-based meal' per day, the confection came with a bit of a twist.

Pouring a bit of syrup on the meal, Oprah, 65, explained on Insta Stories that 'this is a gluten-free, egg-free, dairy-free pancake, made with gluten-free flour, no eggs and no milk, but banana and flaxseed and a little bit of Earth Balance to hold it together.'

Tasty treat: Oprah Winfrey settled down to a plate of pancakes for breakfast Saturday

The chat show icon, who owns a stake in Weight Watchers, said: 'And I will tell you the honest truth – always the honest truth – this is the best pancake I’ve ever had.'

She shared that 'we created this pancake because a friend of mine, Larry Gordon, is celiac, has celiac’s disease, which is like, you can’t play around with that for gluten.

'So we created it because we’re having a brunch and he was coming over, and now this is my all-time favorite pancake. We’re naming it the Larry Gordon pancake.'

Lawrence Gordon, 83, is a producer who has worked on such films as Field Of Dreams, Die Hard, Predator and Lara Croft: Tomb Raider.

The celebrity environmentalist, who recently told British Vogue she has flown exclusively private since 1991, looked comfy in a plush white robe.

As she began eating her blueberry-topped pancakes, she plugged her magazine O, where the recipe will be available.

Throughout the video, Oprah's blond cocker spaniel Sadie could be heard whining down below until her owner finally addressed her.

'I’m not giving you any, but I almost am tempted to give you some, Sadie. You almost got some today,' said Oprah, 'cause this is worth even sharing with Sadie.

Oprah is taking on a challenge posed by One Meal A Day, a book written by James Cameron's fifth and current wife Suzy Amis.
